title: Gatwick Airport
summary: Gatwick Airport (/ˈɡætwɪk/),[3] also known as London Gatwick[2] (IATA: LGW, ICAO: EGKK), is a major international airport near Crawley, West Sussex, England, 29.5 miles (47.5 km) south of Central London.[2][4] It is the second-busiest airport by total passenger traffic in the UK, after Heathrow Airport.[5] Gatwick is the tenth-busiest airport in Europe. It covers a total area of 674 hectares (1,670 acres).[6]
